  27class Hamiltonian:
  28    """
  29    Class contains information about the Hamiltonian to be decomposed.
  30
  31    ## Functionality:
  32    * Build Hamiltonians from prebuilt Spin models
  33    * Add custom Hamiltonians 
  34
  35    TODO:
  36    * Add Hubbard Model
  37
  38    Authors:
  39    * Thomas Steckmann
  40    * Efekan Kokcu
  41    """
  42    def __init__(self, sites, name = None):
  43        """Initializes an empty Hamiltonian, unless name is specified
  44
  45        name is not required as an input to initialize the Hamiltonian, only the number of qubits. After initializing the Hamiltonian, users can use addModel() to add a single, implemented Hamiltonian at a time and use .addTerms() to add lists of terms or individual terms. .removeTerm() can be used to remove a single term at a time
  46
  47        Args:
  48            qubits (int): The number of lattice points the Hamiltonian exists on
  49            name (List of Tuples): Easily build Hamiltonians from native models. 
  50
  51                ### Options:
  52                    - `[(coefficient, 'modelname', periodic boundary conditions boolean)]` - Builds a single Hamiltonian with constant coefficient. Periodic boundary conditions are true or false, false is assumed if not specified
  53                    - `[([list of coefficients], 'modelname')]` - Populates the Hamiltonian using the list of coefficients. Lengths must match
  54                    - `[(coefficient, 'modelname1'),([list of coefficients], 'modelname2')]` - Combines two Hamiltonians. Order my alter default choice of ùñç
  55                #### Examples:
  56                    - `[(1,'xy', True)]` on three qubits gives: XXI + YYI + IXX + IYY + XIX + YIY
  57                    - `[([1,2],'kitaevEven')]` on three qubits gives: 1*XXI + 2*IYY 
  58                ### Currently Implemented Models:
  59                    - xy: (XX + YY)
  60                    - xx: (XXI + IXX)
  61                    - yy: (YYI + IYY)
  62                    - zz: (ZZI + IZZ)
  63                    - tfim: (ZZ + XI + IX)
  64                    - tfxy: (XX + YY + ZI + IZ)
  65                    - transverse_z: (IZ + ZI)
  66                    - kitaev_even: (XXI + IYY)
  67                    - kitaev_odd: (YYI + IXX)
  68                    - heisenberg: (XX + YY + ZZ)
  69                    - TODO: hubbard: (XXII + YYII + IIXX + IIYY + ZIZI + IZIZ)
  70        """
  71        self.sites = sites
  72        self.HTuples = []
  73        self.HCoefs = []
  74        #Builds the Hamiltonian
  75        if name is not None:
  76            for pair in name: 
  77                self.addModel(pair) 
  78
  79    def addModel(self, pair):
  80        """Adds a predefined model to the Hamiltonian object
  81        
  82        Args:
  83            pair (Tuple):
  84                
  85                ### Currently Implemented Models:
  86                    - xy: (XX + YY)
  87                    - xx: (XXI + IXX)
  88                    - yy: (YYI + IYY)
  89                    - zz: (ZZI + IZZ)
  90                    - tfim: (ZZ + XI + IX)
  91                    - tfxy: (XX + YY + ZI + IZ)
  92                    - transverse_z: (IZ + ZI)
  93                    - kitaev_even: (XXI + IYY)
  94                    - kitaev_odd: (YYI + IXX)
  95                    - heisenberg: (XX + YY + ZZ)
  96                    - TODO: hubbard: (XXII + YYII + IIXX + IIYY + ZIZI + IZIZ)
  97        
  98        Raises:
  99            ValueError:  Coefficient list length mismatch
 100            Exception: Invalid model type input
 101        """
 102        if len(pair) == 3: #Handles the boundary condition variable format
 103            hamiltonianTerms = self.generateHamiltonian(pair[1], closed=pair[2]) #pair[1] = modelname, pair[2] = boundary condition
 104            if isinstance(pair[0], list): #pair[0] = coefficients float or list
 105                if len(pair[0]) != len(hamiltonianTerms):
 106                     raise ValueError("Coefficient List mismatch: Expected {} coefficients".format(len(hamiltonianTerms)))
 107                pairedIterable = zip(pair[0],hamiltonianTerms)
 108                for (coefficient, pauliString) in pairedIterable:
 109                    self.HTuples.append(pauliString)
 110                    self.HCoefs.append(coefficient)
 111            elif pair[0]:
 112                coefficient = pair[0]
 113                for pauliString in hamiltonianTerms:
 114                    self.HTuples.append(pauliString)
 115                    self.HCoefs.append(coefficient)
 116        else:
 117            hamiltonianTerms = self.generateHamiltonian(pair[1]) #pair[1] = modelname,
 118            if isinstance(pair[0], list): #pair[0] = coefficients float or list
 119                if len(pair[0]) != len(hamiltonianTerms):
 120                     raise ValueError("Coefficient List mismatch: Expected {} coefficients".format(len(hamiltonianTerms)))
 121                pairedIterable = zip(pair[0],hamiltonianTerms)
 122                for (coefficient, pauliString) in pairedIterable:
 123                    self.HTuples.append(pauliString)
 124                    self.HCoefs.append(coefficient)
 125            elif pair[0]:
 126                coefficient = pair[0]
 127                for pauliString in hamiltonianTerms:
 128                    self.HTuples.append(pauliString)
 129                    self.HCoefs.append(coefficient)
 130
 131    def addTerms(self, pairs):
 132        """Adds custom elements to build out the Hamiltonian
 133
 134        Args:
 135            pair (List of Tuples or Tuple of Lists or Tuple): Formatted as either
 136                * `[(coefficient, PauliString), (coefficient, PauliStringTuple),...]`
 137                * `(coefficient, (PauliString))`
 138                * `([coefficienList],[(PauliStringList)])
 139
 140        Examples:
 141            * `Hamiltonian.addTerms((0.45, (1,3,2,0,0,0)))`
 142            * `Hamiltonian.addTerms([(1,(1,1,0,0)),(2,(2,2,0,0))])
 143            * `Hamiltonian.addTerms(([co1, co2, co3, ...],[(PauliString1),(PauliString2),(PauliString3)...])`
 144
 145        """
 146        if isinstance(pairs, list): #Verifies the User input - if a list, iterates over it
 147            for pair in pairs:
 148                try: #Checks if the element is already in the list and adds it
 149                    index = self.HTuples.index(pair[1])
 150                    self.HCoefs[index] = self.HCoefs[index] + pair[0]
 151                except: #If not in the list, catches warning and adds the new term
 152                    self.HTuples.append(pair[1])
 153                    self.HCoefs.append(pair[0])
 154        elif isinstance(pairs, tuple): #Verifies user input - if a tuple, just adds it
 155            if isinstance(pairs[0], list):
 156                for (co, tup) in zip (pairs[0], pairs[1]):
 157                    try: #Checks if the element is already in the list and adds it
 158                        index = self.HTuples.index(tup)
 159                        self.HCoefs[index] = self.HCoefs[index] + co
 160                    except: #If not in the list, catches warning and adds the new term
 161                        self.HTuples.append(tup)
 162                        self.HCoefs.append(co)
 163            else:
 164                try: #Checks if the element is already in the list and adds it
 165                    index = self.HTuples.index(pairs[1])
 166                    self.HCoefs[index] = self.HCoefs[index] + pairs[0]
 167                except: #If not in the list, catches warning and adds the new term
 168                    self.HTuples.append(pairs[1])
 169                    self.HCoefs.append(pairs[0])
 170
 171    def removeTerm(self, tup):
 172        """Removes the term matching the tuple input. Used for trimming terms off the Hamiltonian
 173        Args:
 174            tup (tuple): A (pauliString)
 175        """
 176        index = self.HTuples.index(tup)
 177        
 178        self.HTuples.pop(index)
 179        self.HCoefs.pop(index)
 180
 181    def generateHamiltonian(self, modelType, closed = False):
 182        """Helper Function to generate Hamiltonians.
 183        
 184        From the model type, generates the Hamiltonian Pauli Strings
 185
 186        Args: 
 187            modelType (Tuple of Strings): See previous documentation
 188            closed (bool): 
 189                True if the model is period.
 190
 191        """
 192        hamiltonian = []
 193
 194        if modelType == "xx": #XXII + IXXI + IIXX
 195            for i in range(self.sites - 1):
 196                term = ((0,) * i) + ((1,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
 197                hamiltonian.append(term)
 198            if  closed:
 199                term = (1,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (1,)
 200                hamiltonian.append(term)
 201
 202            
 203            
 204        elif modelType == "yy": #YYII + IYYI + IIYY
 205            for i in range(self.sites - 1):
 206                term = ((0,) * i) + ((2,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
 207                hamiltonian.append(term)
 208            if  closed:
 209                term = (2,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (2,)
 210                hamiltonian.append(term)
 211
 212            
 213            
 214        elif modelType == "zz": #ZZII + IZZI + IIZZ
 215            for i in range(self.sites - 1):
 216                term = ((0,) * i) + ((3,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
 217                hamiltonian.append(term)
 218            if  closed:
 219                term = (3,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (3,)
 220                hamiltonian.append(term)
 221
 222
 223        elif modelType == "xy": #XXII + YYII + IXXI + IYYI + IIXX + IIYY
 224            for i in range(self.sites - 1):
 225                termX = ((0,) * i) + ((1,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
 226                termY = ((0,) * i) + ((2,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
 227                hamiltonian.append(termX)
 228                hamiltonian.append(termY)
 229            if  closed:
 230                termX = (1,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (1,)
 231                termY = (2,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (2,)
 232                hamiltonian.append(termX)
 233                hamiltonian.append(termY)
 234
 235            
 236        elif modelType == "kitaev_even": #XXII + IYYI + IIXX
 237            for i in range(self.sites - 1):
 238                if i % 2 == 0:
 239                    term = ((0,) * i) + ((1,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
 240                else:
 241                    term = ((0,) * i) + ((2,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
 242                hamiltonian.append(term)
 243            if  closed:
 244                term = (2,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (2,)
 245                hamiltonian.append(term)
 246
 247            
 248            
 249        elif modelType == "kitaev_odd": #YYII + IXXI + IIYY
 250            for i in range(self.sites - 1):
 251                if i % 2 == 0:
 252                    term = ((0,) * i) + ((2,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
 253                else:
 254                    term = ((0,) * i) + ((1,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
 255                hamiltonian.append(term)
 256            if  closed:
 257                term = (1,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (1,)
 258                hamiltonian.append(term)
 259
 260
 261
 262        elif modelType == "heisenberg": #XXII + YYII + ZZII + ...
 263            for i in range(self.sites - 1):
 264                termX = ((0,) * i) + ((1,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
 265                termY = ((0,) * i) + ((2,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
 266                termZ = ((0,) * i) + ((3,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
 267                hamiltonian.append(termX)
 268                hamiltonian.append(termY)
 269                hamiltonian.append(termZ)
 270            if  closed:
 271                termX = (1,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (1,)
 272                termY = (2,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (2,)
 273                termY = (3,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (3,)
 274                hamiltonian.append(termX)
 275                hamiltonian.append(termY)
 276                hamiltonian.append(termZ)
 277
 278            
 279
 280        elif modelType == "tfim": # ZZII + IZZI + IIXZZ + XIII + IXII + IIXI + IIIX
 281            #raise Exception("Warning: TransverseIsing Involution not yet implemented, so m construction will fail")
 282            for i in range(self.sites - 1):
 283                term = ((0,) * i) + (3,3) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
 284                hamiltonian.append(term)
 285            if  closed:
 286                term = (3,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (3,)
 287                hamiltonian.append(term)
 288            for i in range(self.sites):
 289                term = ((0,) * i) + (1,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 1 - i))
 290                hamiltonian.append(term)
 291
 292        elif modelType == 'tfxy':
 293            for i in range(self.sites):
 294                term = (0,)*i + (3,) + (0,)*(self.sites-i-1) 
 295                hamiltonian.append(term)
 296            
 297            for i in range(self.sites-1):
 298                term = (0,)*i + (1,1) + (0,)*(self.sites-i-2) 
 299                hamiltonian.append(term)
 300                term = (0,)*i + (2,2) + (0,)*(self.sites-i-2) 
 301                hamiltonian.append(term)
 302                
 303            if closed:
 304                term = (1,) + (0,)*(self.sites-2) + (1,)
 305                hamiltonian.append(term)
 306                term = (2,) + (0,)*(self.sites-2) + (2,)
 307                hamiltonian.append(term)
 308            
 309
 310        elif modelType == "transverse_z": # ZIII + IZII + IIZI + IIIZ
 311            for i in range(self.sites):
 312                term = ((0,) * i) + (3,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 1 - i))
 313                hamiltonian.append(term)
 314
 315        else:
 316            raise Exception("Invalid Model. Valid models include: 'XX', 'YY', 'ZZ', 'XY', 'KitaevEven', 'KitaevOdd', 'Heisenberg', TransverseIsing', and 'Transverse_Z'")
 317        return hamiltonian
 318        
 319    def getHamiltonian(self, type='tuples'):
 320        """ Based on the type, returns the Hamiltonian from the object and formats it.
 321        Args:
 322            type (String, default = 'tuples'): Specifies the return type of the function.
 323                Valid inputs:
 324
 325                 - 'tuples': Return formatted as `[(coefficient, (PauliString), ... ]`
 326
 327                 - 'printTuples': Prints out to the console ``(coefficient, (PauliString)) \n ...``
 328
 329                 - 'printText': Prints out ``'coefficient * 'PauliString' + ....``
 330
 331                 - 'text': Return formatted as a list of `[[coefficient, 'PauliString']]`
 332        
 333        Returns:
 334            For type=`'tuples'` or type=`'text'`, returns
 335
 336            - `'tuples'`: A list of Coefficient, (PauliString) Tuple pairs
 337            - `'text'`: A List of Coefficient 'PauliString' List pairs
 338        
 339        Raises:
 340            ValueError: Invalid type
 341        """
 342        if type == 'tuples':
 343            returnVal = []
 344            for (co, tup) in zip(self.HCoefs, self.HTuples):
 345                returnVal.append((co,tup))
 346            return returnVal
 347        elif type == 'printTuples':
 348            for (co, tup) in zip(self.HCoefs, self.HTuples):
 349                print((co,tup))
 350        elif type == 'printText':
 351            for (co, tup) in zip(self.HCoefs, self.HTuples):
 352                print(str(co) + " * " + str(paulilabel(tup))) #Prints coefficient'pauliString'
 353        elif type == 'text':
 354            returnlist = []
 355            for (co, tup) in zip(self.HCoefs, self.HTuples):
 356                returnlist.append([co,  str(paulilabel(tup))]) #Prints coefficient'pauliString'
 357            return returnlist
 358        else:
 359            raise ValueError('Invalid Type: Must be "tuples", "printTuples", "printText", or "text"')

 361class Cartan:
 362    """
 363    Class to contain the options for performing Cartan Decomposition on a Hamiltonian
 364        
 365    # Object containing the functions and data required to generate a Cartan Decomposition from a given Hamiltonian. 
 366    from object_based.PauliOps import commutatePauliString
 367
 368    TODO:
 369    * Add in k simplification functions
 370
 371    Authors:
 372    * Thomas Steckmann
 373    * Efekan Kokcu
 374
 375    Functionality:
 376    * Generate Hamiltonian Algebra
 377    * Generate k, m, h partition
 378    * Choose involution (Default - Even/Odd)
 379    * Seed choice of h
 380    * Modify k (Additional Decomposition, TODO: Abelian Decomposition, Piling)
 381    """
 382    def __init__(self, hamObj, involution='evenOdd', order = 0, manualMode=0):
 383        """ Generates the Cartan Object
 384        
 385        Args:
 386            hamObj (Hamiltonian): Passes a Hamiltonian Object containing the full information about the system
 387            involution (String, default='evenOdd'):
 388                Allows a choice of the k,m involution
 389
 390                Options:
 391                * `'evenOdd'`: m contains an even number of non-identity pauli terms in each string, k contains an odd number of non-identity elements
 392                * `'knejaGlaser'`: m contains elements ending in Y or X, k contains elements ending in I or Z
 393                * `'count' + 'X', 'Y', or 'Z'`: Counts of the number of the specified Pauli Tuple. Even count in m, odd in k
 394            order (int, default = 0):
 395                g(H) is generated iteratively until it fails to generate new terms. We call each term in H, [H,H], [H,[H,H]], ... order 0, 1, 2, and going up.
 396                Generally, the larger the system the larger the order of terms required to generate g(H). Setting the order greater than 0 ensure that g(H) will only result in terms the distance of commutators from H.
 397                However, this results in an incomplete algebra for g. Be warned. 
 398            manualMode (bool, default = 0):
 399                Choose either 0 (automatic) or 1 (manual). automatic generates h, k, m, and h when the object is created. manual requires the user call the respective functions.
 400        Attributes:
 401            hamiltonian (::hamiltonian:: object): Allows access to HCoefficients and HTuples
 402            HTuples (List of Tuples): Copies over the HTuples from the hamiltonian object
 403            g (List of Tuples): Generates formatted like k + h + (m without h)
 404            k (List of Tuples): Specified by the decomposition. Changing k regenerates h and the order of g (g = k + h + (m\h))
 405            h (List of Tuples): Specified by SubAlgebra(). Defaults to seeding by m, otherwise allows for inclusion of specific elements
 406        """
 407        self.mode = manualMode
 408        self.hamiltonian = hamObj
 409        self.HTuples = self.hamiltonian.HTuples
 410        if self.mode == 0:
 411            self.g = self.makeGroup(self.HTuples, order)
 412            self.decompose(involution)
 413        
 414
 415    def decompose(self, involutionName):
 416        """
 417        Sets a new Involution using a switch. Regenerates h using the default first element in m
 418
 419        Options:
 420                * `'evenOdd'`: m contains an even number of non-identity pauli terms in each string, k contains an odd nunber of non-idenity elements
 421                * `'knejaGlaser'`: m contains elements ending in Y or X, k contains elements ending in I or Z
 422                * `'count' + 'X', 'Y', or 'Z'`: Counts of the number of the specified Pauli Tuple. Even count in m, odd in k
 423        """
 424        self.involution = involutionName #Store involution name
 425
 426        if involutionName == 'evenOdd': 
 427            (self.m, self.k) = self.evenOdd(self.g)
 428        elif involutionName == 'knejaGlaser':
 429            (self.m, self.k) = self.knejaGlaser(self.g)
 430        elif involutionName == 'countX':
 431            (self.m, self.k) = self.elemcount(self.g, 1)
 432        elif involutionName == 'countY':
 433            (self.m, self.k) = self.elemcount(self.g, 2)
 434        elif involutionName == 'countZ': 
 435            (self.m, self.k) = self.elemcount(self.g, 3)
 436        invalidInvolutionFlag = 0
 437        for Hi in self.HTuples:
 438            if not Hi in self.m:
 439                invalidInvolutionFlag = 1
 440                break
 441        if invalidInvolutionFlag == 1:
 442            raise Exception('Invalid Involution. Please Choose an involution such that H ‚äÇ m')
 443        if self.mode == 0:
 444            self.subAlgebra()
 445
 446    def makeGroup(self,g, order=0):
 447        '''
 448        Returns a closure of a given list of pauli strings (g). The list doesn't include any coefficients, it is just
 449        a tuple like (0,2,3) representing IYZ.
 450
 451        Args:
 452            g (List of Tuples):
 453                A set of Pauli Strings
 454            order (int, default = 0): 
 455                The number of terms to include in g. If order = 0, generates the full g(H). 0th order is H, 1st is [H,H], and 2nd is [H,[H,H]], etc
 456
 457
 458        Returns:
 459            List of Tuples: ùñå(H), the Hamiltonian Algebra generated by the input g
 460        '''
 461        if order == 0:
 462            flag = 0 
 463            while (flag == 0):
 464                flag = 1
 465                L = len(g) #g initializes as H
 466                #initialize commutations
 467                coms = [] #Tracks the commutations generated in this iteration
 468
 469                #calculate all possible commutations 
 470                for i in range(L): #First index in the commutator
 471                    for j in range(i,L): #Second index is all terms after this in the list
 472                        m = commutatePauliString(1,g[i],1,g[j]) #generates the commutation
 473                        #add all new ones to the list, if they are not in the list and are not 0
 474                        if (abs(m[0])>0) & (self.included(coms,m[1])==0) & (self.included(g,m[1])==0):
 475                            #set flag to 0 whenever there is a new term to be added. If the flag remains 1, the loop terminates
 476                            flag = 0
 477                            coms.append(m[1])
 478
 479                #then merge initial list with these new commutations
 480                g = g + coms
 481            return g
 482        else:
 483            loopOrder = 0
 484            flag = 0 
 485            while (flag == 0 and loopOrder <= order):
 486                flag = 1
 487                L = len(g) #g initializes as H
 488                #initialize commutations
 489                coms = [] #Tracks the commutations generated in this iteration
 490
 491                #calculate all possible commutations 
 492                for i in range(L): #First index in the commutator
 493                    for j in range(i,L): #Second index is all terms after this in the list
 494                        m = commutatePauliString(1,g[i],1,g[j]) #generates the commutation
 495                        #add all new ones to the list, if they are not in the list and are not 0
 496                        if (abs(m[0])>0) & (self.included(coms,m[1])==0) & (self.included(g,m[1])==0):
 497                            #set flag to 0 whenever there is a new term to be added. If the flag remains 1, the loop terminates
 498                            flag = 0
 499                            coms.append(m[1])
 500
 501                #then merge initial list with these new commutations
 502                loopOrder += 1
 503                g = g + coms
 504            return g
 505
 506    
 507    def elemcount(self,g,element):
 508        '''
 509        Counts the number of given elements (X,Y or Z in number), and puts even numbers in m, odd numbers in k. 
 510        For element=2, it corresponds to Œ∏(g) = -g^T
 511        '''    
 512        k = []
 513        m = []
 514        
 515        for i in range(len(g)):
 516            elem = g[i]
 517            count = 0
 518            for j in range(len(elem)):
 519                if elem[j] == element:
 520                    count=count+1
 521            if count%2 == 0:
 522                m.append(elem)
 523            else:
 524                k.append(elem)
 525            
 526        return m,k
 527    
 528    def included(self,g,m):
 529        '''Following function returns 0 if tuple m is not incu=luded in tuple list g, returns 1 if it is included.
 530            
 531            Args:
 532                g (List of Tuples): 
 533                    The List of Pauli string elements in the Hamiltonian Algebra ùñå(H)
 534                m (Tuple of 0,1,2,3):
 535                    Pauli string in the set ùñí
 536
 537            Returns: 
 538                1 if m is in g
 539                0 if not
 540        '''
 541        L = len(g)
 542        res = 0    
 543        for i in range(L):
 544            if g[i]==m:
 545                res = 1
 546                break
 547        
 548        return res
 549
 550
 551    def evenOdd(self,g):
 552        """ Partitions the Algebra by counting the number of non-idenity Pauli elements
 553
 554        Args:
 555            g (List of Tuples):
 556                The Algebra to partition
 557        
 558        Returns:
 559            k (List of Tuples):
 560                The List of Pauli Strings with Odd non-identity terms
 561            m (List of Tuples):
 562                The List of Pauli Strings with Even non-idenity terms
 563        """
 564        k = []
 565        m = []
 566        
 567        for i in range(len(g)):
 568            elem = g[i]
 569            count = 0
 570            for j in range(len(elem)):
 571                if elem[j] > 0:
 572                    count=count+1
 573            if count%2 == 0:
 574                m.append(elem)
 575            else:
 576                k.append(elem)
 577                
 578        return m,k
 579
 580    def knejaGlaser(self,g):
 581        '''
 582        Following one is the Kneja Glaser decomposition. 
 583        It corresponds to \theta(g) = III...IZ g III..IZ
 584        ''' 
 585        k = []
 586        m = []
 587        
 588        for i in range(len(g)):
 589            elem = g[i]
 590            last = elem[len(elem)-1]
 591            if  (last == 3) | (last == 0):
 592                k.append(elem)
 593            else:
 594                m.append(elem)
 595            
 596        return m,k
 597
 598    def subAlgebra(self,seedList=None):
 599        """ Generates h from a list of Commuting elements in the seedList 
 600        
 601        Args:
 602            seedList (List of Tuples): List of (PauliStrings). Must be commuting
 603        
 604        TODO:
 605            Verify that seedList is commuting
 606        """
 607        if seedList == None:
 608            seedList = [self.m[0]]
 609        h = seedList.copy()
 610        for i in range(len(self.m)):
 611            flag = 0
 612            for j in range(len(h)):
 613                if self.m[i] == h[j]:
 614                    flag = 1
 615                    break
 616                    
 617                comm = commutatePauliString(1, h[j], 1, self.m[i])
 618                if comm[0] != 0:
 619                    flag = 1
 620                    break
 621            if flag == 0:
 622                h.append(self.m[i]) 
 623                
 624        self.h = h
 625        #Regenerates the ordering for g, required to generate commutators
 626
 627        m_tuples = self.m.copy()
 628        #Strips h from m
 629        index = 0
 630        while index < len(m_tuples): #
 631            flag = 0 #When flag = 1, 
 632            for i in range(len(self.h)):
 633                if m_tuples[index] == self.h[i]:
 634                    flag = 1
 635                    m_tuples.pop(index)
 636                    break
 637            if flag == 0:
 638                index = index + 1
 639        self.g = self.k + self.h + m_tuples #Reorder g
 640
 641class FindParameters:
 642    """
 643    From a Cartan Decomposition, runs the optimizer to find the appropriate parameters for a circuit
 644
 645    Warning: Very long runtime for more than 8ish qubits
 646
 647    Authors:
 648    * Thomas Steckmann
 649    * Efekan Kokcu
 650    """
 651    def __init__(self, cartan, saveFileName = None, loadfileName=None, optimizerMethod='BFGS', accuracy=1e-5, initialGuess=None, steps = 5000, useCommTables=True):
 652        """
 653        Initializing a FindParameters class automatically runs the optimizer over the Cartan decomposition and provided Hamiltonian
 654        
 655        If saveFileName is provided, verifies file location before proceeding, and saves the output as a csv
 656        If loadFileName is provided, does not run the optimizer and instead reads data from the provided file
 657
 658        TODO:
 659            * Write Load file functions
 660        
 661        Args:
 662            cartan (Obj Cartan): The Cartan object containing the k,h, and Hamiltonian information
 663            saveFileName (String, default=None): path to save the output. Do not include an extension ('csv' or 'txt')
 664            loadFileName (String, default=None): path to a csv containing previous optimizer results. Do not add .csv or .txt
 665            optimizer (String, default='BFGS'): The Scipy optimizer to use. Easy to add new ones, but must be done manually
 666                
 667                Options: 
 668                    * `'BFGS'` : Uses Gradient
 669                    * `'Powel'`: Does not use Gradient
 670            accuracy (float, default=1e-5): Optimizer convergence Criteria
 671            initialGuess (List of values): Allows the user to specify the inital guess for k. Must be correct, no input checking is currently implemented
 672            steps (int): The maximum number of optimization steps before termination
 673        
 674        Returns:
 675            * Progress updates and runtime predictions
 676            * prints the results of the optimization
 677        """
 678        #Initialize Values
 679        self.cartan = cartan #Extracts the hamiltonian object
 680        self.hamiltonian = self.cartan.hamiltonian #Extracts the hamiltonain objects
 681        self.useCommTables = useCommTables
 682        self.optimizerMethod = optimizerMethod
 683        self.accuracy = accuracy
 684        self.lenK = len(self.cartan.k)
 685        self.lenh = len(self.cartan.h)
 686        self.steps = steps
 687        #Begin Optimizer
 688        if loadfileName is not None: #If able to, loads prior results
 689            #with open(loadfileName + '.csv', "r") as f:
 690            #    csv_reader = csv.reader(csv_file, delimiter=',')
 691            raise Exception('Unable to continue, file loading is not implemented')
 692        elif self.lenK == 0: #Specific exception handling to prevent breaking on commuting Hamiltonians 
 693            self.hCoefs = self.hamiltonian.HCoefs
 694            #self.hTuples = self.hamiltonian.HTuples
 695            self.kCoefs = []
 696        else:   
 697            if saveFileName is not None:
 698                if not os.access(saveFileName, os.W_OK): #Verifies write permission
 699                    raise Exception('Save File location does not have write access. Aborting Optimization.')
 700                self.saveFileName = saveFileName
 701            
 702            #Generating reused values before begining the optimizer loop
 703            if useCommTables == True: #Faster, but only works for a complete algebra
 704                self.setCommutatorTables() #Sets values for a look-up table for the commutators
 705                self.generateIndexLists()
 706            #Generates coefficients for v, a dense element in the h algebra
 707            pi = np.pi
 708            self.vcoefs = [1]
 709            for i in range(len(self.cartan.h)-1):
 710                term = pi*self.vcoefs[i]
 711                while term > 1:
 712                    term = term-1
 713                self.vcoefs.append(term)
 714            
 715
 716            
 717            #If specified, defines an inital guess. If not, sets it to all zeros
 718            if initialGuess is not None:
 719                self.initialGuess = initialGuess
 720            else:
 721                self.initialGuess = initialGuess = np.zeros(len(self.cartan.k))
 722            
 723            #Calls the function that contains the optimizer loop
 724            total_time = time.time()
 725            self.optimizerOutput = self.optimize()
 726            timepassed = time.time() - total_time
 727            print('--- ' + str(timepassed) +  ' seconds ---')
 728
 729            self.sethVecFromk()
 730            self.error = self.errorhVec()
 731
 732            print('Optimization Error:')
 733            print(self.error)
 734
 735            if saveFileName is not None:
 736                self.saveKH()
 737
 738    def setCommutatorTables(self):
 739        """ 
 740        Generates commutator look-up tables for the commutators of different elements
 741
 742        Important: g must be ordered as k + h + (the rest of m). Does not work without this ordering
 743        """
 744        
 745        k_tuples = self.cartan.k.copy()
 746        h_tuples = self.cartan.h.copy()
 747        m_tuples = self.cartan.m.copy()
 748        
 749        index = 0
 750        
 751        while index < len(m_tuples):
 752            flag = 0
 753            for i in range(len(h_tuples)):
 754                if m_tuples[index] == h_tuples[i]:
 755                    flag = 1
 756                    m_tuples.pop(index)
 757                    break
 758            if flag == 0:
 759                index = index + 1
 760        
 761        g_tuples = k_tuples + h_tuples + m_tuples
 762        
 763        self.comm_table = np.zeros((len(g_tuples),len(g_tuples)))
 764        self.comm_coefs = np.zeros((len(g_tuples),len(g_tuples)),dtype=np.complex_)
 765        
 766        for i in range(len(g_tuples)):
 767            for j in range(len(g_tuples)):
 768                res = self.commutatePauliString(1,g_tuples[i],1,g_tuples[j])
 769                
 770                self.comm_coefs[i][j] = res[0]
 771                
 772                if res[0]==0:
 773                    self.comm_table[i][j]=0
 774                else:
 775                    for q in range(len(g_tuples)):
 776                        if res[1] == g_tuples[q]:
 777                            self.comm_table[i][j] = q
 778    
 779    def generateIndexLists(self):
 780        """Generates a lists for H, h, and k using indices in g instead of as lists of Tuples"""
 781
 782        #Computes the indices of each of the k elements in the g list                   
 783        self.kElementIndices = []
 784        for i in range(len(self.cartan.k)):
 785            for j in range(len(self.cartan.g)):
 786                if self.cartan.k[i] == self.cartan.g[j]:
 787                    self.kElementIndices.append(j)
 788                    break  
 789
 790        #computes the indicies of each of the Ham elements in the g list
 791        self.HElementIndices = [] 
 792        Htuples = self.hamiltonian.HTuples
 793        for i in range(len(Htuples)):
 794            for j in range(len(self.cartan.g)):
 795                if self.cartan.g[j]==Htuples[i]:
 796                    self.HElementIndices.append(j)
 797                    break
 798        
 799        #Computes the indices of the of the h elements in the g list:
 800        self.hElementIndices = [] 
 801        htuples = self.cartan.h
 802        for i in range(len(htuples)):
 803            for j in range(len(self.cartan.g)):
 804                if self.cartan.g[j]==htuples[i]:
 805                    self.hElementIndices.append(j)
 806                    break
 807
 808    def optimize(self):
 809        """
 810        Chooses between methods of optimization. Current options are 'BFGS' and 'Powell' from scipy.optimize
 811
 812        Sets the attribute kCoefs, which are the results of the optimizer
 813
 814        Returns: 
 815            The object returned by the Scipy Optimizer. Contains information about the minimum, parameters, and a few other things
 816        """
 817        initialGuess = self.initialGuess
 818        if self.optimizerMethod == 'BFGS':
 819            optimiumReturn = scipy.optimize.minimize(self.CostFunction,initialGuess, method='BFGS', jac = self.gradCostFunction,options={'disp':True, 'gtol':self.accuracy, 'maxiter':self.steps})
 820        elif self.optimizerMethod == 'Powell':
 821            optimiumReturn = scipy.optimize.minimize(self.CostFunction,initialGuess, method='Powell',options={'disp':True, 'ftol':self.accuracy, 'maxiter':self.steps})
 822        self.kCoefs = optimiumReturn.x
 823        return optimiumReturn
 824
 825    def generalCostFunction(self, thetas1, thetas2, index):
 826        '''
 827        This returns Tr(e<sup>i‚Ä¢thetas1‚Ä¢k1</sup>‚Ä¢v‚Ä¢e<sup>-thetas2‚Ä¢k2</sup>‚Ä¢H)
 828        (To make it clear, for Earp and Pachos function, we have k1=k2=k, thetas1=thetas2=thetas)
 829
 830        Args:
 831            thetas1 (List): The coefficients for the k_tuples on the left side
 832            thetas2 (List): The coefficients for the K_tuples on the right side
 833            index (int): The number of k elements acting on v
 834
 835        Returns:
 836            Tr(e<sup>i‚Ä¢thetas1‚Ä¢k1</sup>)‚Ä¢v‚Ä¢e<sup>-thetas2‚Ä¢k2</sup>‚Ä¢H)
 837        
 838        TODO: 
 839            * Comment the steps in this section
 840        '''
 841        if self.useCommTables:
 842            maxsize = 0
 843            #Prepares two lists: One for v matching dense coefficients with indices in g, One for H matching coefficients to indeices
 844            resV = [self.vcoefs,self.hElementIndices]
 845            resH = [self.hamiltonian.HCoefs, self.HElementIndices]
 846
 847            for i in range(len(thetas1)-1,index,-1):
 848                resV = self.adj_action(thetas1[i],self.kElementIndices[i],resV[0],resV[1])
 849
 850            
 851            #add each exp(thetas2*k2) to the list in reverse order and negative coefficients
 852            for i in range(index):
 853                resH = self.adj_action(-thetas2[i],self.kElementIndices[i],resH[0],resH[1])
 854
 855            #create identity matrix for this dimensions
 856            I = (0,)*self.hamiltonian.sites
 857            
 858            
 859            resV = self.multiplyLinCombRound([1],[I],resV[0],resV[1],self.accuracy)  
 860            
 861            if index >= 0:
 862                resV = self.multiplyLinCombRound([math.cos(thetas1[index]),1j*math.sin(thetas1[index])],[I,self.cartan.k[index]],resV[0],resV[1],self.accuracy)    
 863
 864                resV = self.multiplyLinCombRound(resV[0],resV[1],[math.cos(thetas2[index]),-1j*math.sin(thetas2[index])],[I,self.cartan.k[index]],self.accuracy)    
 865
 866                    
 867            #get trace of v*H
 868            trace = 0
 869            for i in range(len(resV[0])):
 870                for j in range(len(resH[0])):
 871                    if resV[1][i] == self.cartan.g[int(resH[1][j])]: #Checks if the elements are the same
 872                        trace = trace + resV[0][i]*resH[0][j]
 873            
 874            return trace
 875        else: #Does not use the list index format, so computing commutators is slower
 876            maxsize = 0
 877            #Prepares two lists: One for v matching dense coefficients with indices in g, One for H matching coefficients to indeices
 878            resV = [self.vcoefs,self.cartan.h]
 879            resH = [self.hamiltonian.HCoefs, self.hamiltonian.HTuples]
 880
 881            for i in range(len(thetas1)-1,index,-1):
 882                resV = self.adj_action(thetas1[i],self.cartan.k[i],resV[0],resV[1])
 883
 884            
 885            #add each exp(thetas2*k2) to the list in reverse order and negative coefficients
 886            for i in range(index):
 887                resH = self.adj_action(-thetas2[i],self.cartan.k[i],resH[0],resH[1])
 888
 889            #create identity matrix for this dimensions
 890            I = (0,)*self.hamiltonian.sites
 891            
 892            
 893            resV = self.multiplyLinCombRound([1],[I],resV[0],resV[1],self.accuracy)  
 894            
 895            if index >= 0:
 896                resV = self.multiplyLinCombRound([math.cos(thetas1[index]),1j*math.sin(thetas1[index])],[I,self.cartan.k[index]],resV[0],resV[1],self.accuracy)    
 897
 898                resV = self.multiplyLinCombRound(resV[0],resV[1],[math.cos(thetas2[index]),-1j*math.sin(thetas2[index])],[I,self.cartan.k[index]],self.accuracy)    
 899
 900                    
 901            #get trace of v*H
 902            trace = 0
 903            for i in range(len(resV[0])):
 904                for j in range(len(resH[0])):
 905                    if resV[1][i] == resH[1][j]:
 906                        trace = trace + resV[0][i]*resH[0][j]
 907            
 908            return trace
 909    def CostFunction(self, thetas):
 910        '''
 911        returns Tr(exp(thetas‚Ä¢k)‚Ä¢v‚Ä¢exp(-thetas‚Ä¢k)‚Ä¢H)
 912        '''
 913        
 914        val = self.generalCostFunction(thetas, thetas, -1)
 915        result = val.real
 916
 917        return result
 918
 919    def gradCostFunction(self, thetas):
 920        '''
 921        returns gradient of funky. Order of derivatives is the order of the parameters thetas.
 922        '''
 923        
 924        res = np.zeros(len(thetas))
 925        
 926        for i in range(len(thetas)):
 927            thetascopy = thetas.copy()
 928            thetascopy[i] = thetascopy[i]+math.pi/2
 929            
 930            diff = self.generalCostFunction(thetascopy,thetas, i) + self.generalCostFunction(thetas,thetascopy,i)
 931            
 932            res[i] = diff.real
 933            
 934        return res
 935
 936    def adj_action(self,theta,k,coefs,tuples): 
 937        '''Computes Ad<sub>k</sub>(m) = e<sup>i‚Ä¢theta</sup>(coefs ‚Ä¢ tuples)e<sup>-i‚Ä¢theta</sup>
 938        Also known as the Adjoint Representation
 939
 940        Args:
 941            theta (float): A single value, the coeffient of the k PauilString
 942            k (Tuple): A (PauliString)
 943            coefs (List of floats, can be complex): The coefficients indexed in order of the elements in tuples
 944            tuples (List of tuples): A List of (PauliStrings)
 945        
 946        Returns:
 947            The Algebraic element in m which is the result of the Adjoint Action (Representation)
 948        '''
 949        if self.useCommTables:
 950            result = [[],[]]
 951            
 952            for i in range(len(coefs)): #Generally, this is applied to v, an element in h and in m. Iterates over the elements in m
 953                m = tuples[i] #m is the index of some m element
 954                c = coefs[i] #c is the associate index
 955            
 956                res = [[c],[m]] #Just establishes the normal coefficient + tupleIndex pair
 957                comm = self.commutatePauliString(1,k,c/2,m) #Computes the commutator of the m currently in the loopand input k element,
 958                if comm[0] != 0:
 959                    res = [[c*math.cos(2*theta),1j*math.sin(2*theta)*comm[0]],[m,comm[1]]]  #If they do not commute, computes ?? (The exponential?)
 960                    
 961                for q in range(len(res[0])):
 962                    flag = 0
 963                    for j in range(len(result[0])):
 964                        if res[1][q] == result[1][j]:
 965                            result[0][j] = result[0][j] + res[0][q]
 966                            flag = 1
 967                            break
 968                    if flag == 0:
 969                        result[0].append(res[0][q])
 970                        result[1].append(res[1][q])
 971                            
 972            return result
 973        else:
 974
 975            result = [[],[]]
 976            
 977            for i in range(len(coefs)): #Generally, this is applied to v, an element in h and in m. Iterates over the elements in m
 978                m = tuples[i] #m is the index of some m element
 979                c = coefs[i] #c is the associate index
 980            
 981                res = [[c],[m]] #Just establishes the normal coefficient + tupleIndex pair
 982                comm = self.commutatePauliString(1,k,c/2,m) #Computes the commutator of the m currently in the loopand input k element,
 983                if comm[0] != 0:
 984                    res = [[c*math.cos(2*theta),1j*math.sin(2*theta)*comm[0]],[m,comm[1]]]  #If they do not commute, computes ?? (The exponential?)
 985                    
 986                for q in range(len(res[0])):
 987                    flag = 0
 988                    for j in range(len(result[0])):
 989                        if res[1][q] == result[1][j]:
 990                            result[0][j] = result[0][j] + res[0][q]
 991                            flag = 1
 992                            break
 993                    if flag == 0:
 994                        result[0].append(res[0][q])
 995                        result[1].append(res[1][q])
 996                            
 997            return result
 998        
 999    def sethVecFromk(self):
1000        '''
1001        Returns h = exp(-thetas‚Ä¢k)‚Ä¢H‚Ä¢exp(thetas‚Ä¢k)
1002
1003        Defines hErrorTuples and hErrorCoefs, which are the exact result of the adjoint representation. The result is in m, not in h, though it is mostly in h. 
1004
1005        hCoefs and hTuples are the results stripped of the components in m
1006        '''
1007
1008        I = (0,)*self.hamiltonian.sites
1009        
1010        res = [self.hamiltonian.HCoefs, self.hamiltonian.HTuples]
1011        
1012        #calculate exp(+...)*H*exp(-...)
1013        for i in range(len(self.kCoefs)):
1014            res = self.adj_action(-self.kCoefs[i],self.cartan.k[i],res[0],res[1])
1015        #Strips off error terms that ended up in m
1016
1017        self.hErrorTuples = res[1]
1018        self.hErrorCoefs = res[0]
1019
1020        self.hCoefs = []
1021        for w in self.cartan.h:
1022            hflag = 0
1023            for u in range(len(self.hErrorTuples)):
1024                if w == self.hErrorTuples[u]:
1025                    self.hCoefs.append(self.hErrorCoefs[u])
1026                    hflag = 1
1027                    break
1028            if hflag == 0:
1029                self.hCoefs.append(0)
1030        self.hTuples = self.cartan.h
1031        
1032    def errorhVec(self):
1033        '''Gets the norm square of the part in hcoefs‚Ä¢htuples that is orthogonal to Cartan subalgebra h.
1034        '''
1035        result = 0
1036        
1037        for i in range(len(self.hErrorCoefs)):
1038            
1039            term = self.hErrorTuples[i]
1040            flag = 0
1041            for j in range(self.lenh):
1042                if term == self.hTuples[j]:
1043                    flag = 1
1044                    break
1045            if flag == 0:
1046                result = result + abs(self.hErrorCoefs[i])**2
1047                
1048        return result
1049
1050    def multiplyLinComb(self,A,tuplesA,B,tuplesB):
1051        '''
1052        Returns multiplication of two linear combinations of Pauli terms 
1053        '''
1054
1055        a = len(A)
1056        b = len(B)
1057        
1058        C = []
1059        tuplesC = []
1060        csize = 0
1061        
1062        for i in range(a):
1063            for j in range(b):
1064                term = self.multiplyPauliString(A[i],tuplesA[i],B[j],tuplesB[j])
1065                flag = 0
1066                for k in range(csize):
1067                    if tuplesC[k]==term[1]:
1068                        flag = 1
1069                        C[k] = C[k]+term[0]
1070                if flag == 0:
1071                    C.append(term[0])
1072                    tuplesC.append(term[1])
1073                    csize = csize + 1
1074        
1075        return C, tuplesC
1076    
1077    def multiplyPauliString(self,a,tupleA,b,tupleB):
1078        """Computes the multiplication of two Pauli Strings representated as a tuple
1079
1080        Args:
1081            a (np.complex128): 
1082                The coefficient of the first Pauli String term
1083            tupleA (Tuple or index in g):
1084                tuple represenation of the first Pauli String
1085            b (np.complex128):
1086                The coefficient of the second Pauli String term
1087            tupleB (Tuple or index in g): 
1088                tuple represenation of the second Pauli String
1089
1090        Returns:
1091            c (np.complex128):
1092                The coefficient of the result a‚Ä¢TupleA . b‚Ä¢TupleB = c‚Ä¢TupleC, where c (the sign of the product of Paulis ‚Ä¢ a ‚Ä¢ b)
1093            tupleC (tuple) :
1094                the elementwise product of the PauliString, ignoring coefficients. 
1095        """
1096        if type(tupleA) != tuple:
1097            tupleA = self.cartan.g[int(tupleA)]
1098        if type(tupleB) != tuple:
1099            tupleB = self.cartan.g[int(tupleB)]
1100            
1101        sites = len(tupleA)
1102        #builds up the result Tuple C
1103        tupleC = ()
1104        sign = 1 # sign(a.b)
1105        
1106        #Iterate elementwise over the tuple
1107        for i in range(sites):
1108            #tupleC is the tuple represenation of the result of the commutator 
1109            tupleC += (((tupleA[i] + tupleB[i]*RULES[tupleA[i]]) % 4),)
1110            #Complex integer product of all the elementwise multiplications
1111            sign = sign * SIGN_RULES[tupleA[i]][tupleB[i]]
1112            
1113        c = a * b * sign
1114        return c, tupleC  
1115    
1116    def commutatePauliString(self,a,tupleA,b,tupleB):
1117        """Computes the commutator of two Pauli Strings representated as a tuple
1118
1119        Args:
1120            a (np.complex128): 
1121                The coefficient of the first Pauli String term
1122            tupleA (Tuple, integer): 
1123                tuple represenation of the first Pauli String, or the index in the commutator table
1124            b (np.complex128): 
1125                The coefficient of the second Pauli String term
1126            tupleB (tuple, int): 
1127                tuple represenation of the second Pauli String, or the index in the commutator table
1128        
1129        Returns:
1130            c (np.complex128):
1131                The coefficient of the result [a‚Ä¢TupleA,b‚Ä¢TupleB] = c‚Ä¢TupleC, where c is the Structure Constant ‚Ä¢ a ‚Ä¢ b.
1132            
1133            tupleC (tuple): 
1134                the elementwise commutator of the PauliString, ignoring coefficients. 
1135        """
1136        
1137        if type(tupleA)==tuple:
1138        
1139            sites = len(tupleA)
1140            #builds up the result Tuple C
1141            tupleC = ()
1142
1143            signForward = 1 # sign(a.b)
1144            signBackward = 1 # sign(b.a) 
1145
1146
1147            #Iterate elementwise over the tuple
1148            for i in range(sites):
1149                #tupleC is the tuple represenation of the result of the commutator 
1150                tupleC += (((tupleA[i] + tupleB[i]*RULES[tupleA[i]]) % 4),)
1151                #Complex integer product of all the elementwise multiplications going forward
1152                signForward = signForward * SIGN_RULES[tupleA[i]][tupleB[i]]
1153                #Complex integer product of all the elementwise multiplications going backward
1154                signBackward = signBackward * SIGN_RULES[tupleB[i]][tupleA[i]]
1155
1156            #Checks the signs forward and backwards. If they are the same, it commutes
1157            if signForward == signBackward:
1158                return (0,tupleC)
1159            else:
1160                c = a * b * 2*signForward
1161                return c, tupleC
1162        
1163        else:
1164            return (a*b*self.comm_coefs[int(tupleA)][int(tupleB)]), self.comm_table[int(tupleA)][int(tupleB)] 
1165    
1166    def multiplyLinCombRound(self,A,tuplesA,B,tuplesB, accur):
1167        '''
1168        Returns multiplication of two linear combinations of Pauli terms, and rounds things that are smaller than accur to zero. 
1169        '''
1170
1171        a = len(A)
1172        b = len(B)
1173        
1174        C = []
1175        tuplesC = []
1176        csize = 0
1177        
1178        for i in range(a):
1179            for j in range(b):
1180                term = self.multiplyPauliString(A[i],tuplesA[i],B[j],tuplesB[j])
1181                flag = 0
1182                for k in range(csize):
1183                    if tuplesC[k]==term[1]:
1184                        flag = 1
1185                        C[k] = C[k]+term[0]
1186                if (flag == 0) & (abs(term[0])>accur):
1187                    C.append(term[0])
1188                    tuplesC.append(term[1])
1189                    csize = csize + 1
1190        
1191        return C, tuplesC
1192
1193    def printResult(self):
1194        """ Prints out the results of the otpimization """
1195        print("Printing Results:")
1196        print("K elements \n")
1197        for (co, tup) in zip(self.kCoefs, self.cartan.k):
1198            print(str(co).ljust(20) + '*' + str(IO.paulilabel(tup)))
1199        print('\n h elements: \n ')
1200        for (co, tup) in zip(self.hCoefs, self.cartan.h):
1201            print(str(co).ljust(25) + '*' + str(IO.paulilabel(tup)))
1202        print('Normed Error |KHK - Exact|:')
1203        U_cartan = CQS.util.verification.KHK(self.kCoefs, self.hCoefs,self.cartan.k, self.cartan.h)
1204
1205        U_exact = CQS.util.verification.exactU(self.hamiltonian.HCoefs, self.hamiltonian.HTuples, 1)
1206
1207        print(np.linalg.norm(U_exact - U_cartan))

1216        fileNameCSV = self.saveFileName + '.csv'
1217        #Converts the formatting
1218        solutionList = [['h', 'hCoefs', 'k', 'kCoefs']]
1219        for (h, hCo, k, kCoefs) in zip(self.hTuples, self.hCoefs, self.cartan.k, self.kCoefs):
1220            solutionList.append([h, hCo, k, kCoefs])
1221        with open( fileNameCSV, "w", newline='') as f:
1222                writer = csv.writer(f)
1223                writer.writerows(solutionList)

class Hamiltonian: 
 28class Hamiltonian:
 29    """
 30    Class contains information about the Hamiltonian to be decomposed.
 31
 32    ## Functionality:
 33    * Build Hamiltonians from prebuilt Spin models
 34    * Add custom Hamiltonians 
 35
 36    TODO:
 37    * Add Hubbard Model
 38
 39    Authors:
 40    * Thomas Steckmann
 41    * Efekan Kokcu
 42    """
 43    def __init__(self, sites, name = None):
 44        """Initializes an empty Hamiltonian, unless name is specified
 45
 46        name is not required as an input to initialize the Hamiltonian, only the number of qubits. After initializing the Hamiltonian, users can use addModel() to add a single, implemented Hamiltonian at a time and use .addTerms() to add lists of terms or individual terms. .removeTerm() can be used to remove a single term at a time
 47
 48        Args:
 49            qubits (int): The number of lattice points the Hamiltonian exists on
 50            name (List of Tuples): Easily build Hamiltonians from native models. 
 51
 52                ### Options:
 53                    - `[(coefficient, 'modelname', periodic boundary conditions boolean)]` - Builds a single Hamiltonian with constant coefficient. Periodic boundary conditions are true or false, false is assumed if not specified
 54                    - `[([list of coefficients], 'modelname')]` - Populates the Hamiltonian using the list of coefficients. Lengths must match
 55                    - `[(coefficient, 'modelname1'),([list of coefficients], 'modelname2')]` - Combines two Hamiltonians. Order my alter default choice of ùñç
 56                #### Examples:
 57                    - `[(1,'xy', True)]` on three qubits gives: XXI + YYI + IXX + IYY + XIX + YIY
 58                    - `[([1,2],'kitaevEven')]` on three qubits gives: 1*XXI + 2*IYY 
 59                ### Currently Implemented Models:
 60                    - xy: (XX + YY)
 61                    - xx: (XXI + IXX)
 62                    - yy: (YYI + IYY)
 63                    - zz: (ZZI + IZZ)
 64                    - tfim: (ZZ + XI + IX)
 65                    - tfxy: (XX + YY + ZI + IZ)
 66                    - transverse_z: (IZ + ZI)
 67                    - kitaev_even: (XXI + IYY)
 68                    - kitaev_odd: (YYI + IXX)
 69                    - heisenberg: (XX + YY + ZZ)
 70                    - TODO: hubbard: (XXII + YYII + IIXX + IIYY + ZIZI + IZIZ)
 71        """
 72        self.sites = sites
 73        self.HTuples = []
 74        self.HCoefs = []
 75        #Builds the Hamiltonian
 76        if name is not None:
 77            for pair in name: 
 78                self.addModel(pair) 
 79
 80    def addModel(self, pair):
 81        """Adds a predefined model to the Hamiltonian object
 82        
 83        Args:
 84            pair (Tuple):
 85                
 86                ### Currently Implemented Models:
 87                    - xy: (XX + YY)
 88                    - xx: (XXI + IXX)
 89                    - yy: (YYI + IYY)
 90                    - zz: (ZZI + IZZ)
 91                    - tfim: (ZZ + XI + IX)
 92                    - tfxy: (XX + YY + ZI + IZ)
 93                    - transverse_z: (IZ + ZI)
 94                    - kitaev_even: (XXI + IYY)
 95                    - kitaev_odd: (YYI + IXX)
 96                    - heisenberg: (XX + YY + ZZ)
 97                    - TODO: hubbard: (XXII + YYII + IIXX + IIYY + ZIZI + IZIZ)
 98        
 99        Raises:
100            ValueError:  Coefficient list length mismatch
101            Exception: Invalid model type input
102        """
103        if len(pair) == 3: #Handles the boundary condition variable format
104            hamiltonianTerms = self.generateHamiltonian(pair[1], closed=pair[2]) #pair[1] = modelname, pair[2] = boundary condition
105            if isinstance(pair[0], list): #pair[0] = coefficients float or list
106                if len(pair[0]) != len(hamiltonianTerms):
107                     raise ValueError("Coefficient List mismatch: Expected {} coefficients".format(len(hamiltonianTerms)))
108                pairedIterable = zip(pair[0],hamiltonianTerms)
109                for (coefficient, pauliString) in pairedIterable:
110                    self.HTuples.append(pauliString)
111                    self.HCoefs.append(coefficient)
112            elif pair[0]:
113                coefficient = pair[0]
114                for pauliString in hamiltonianTerms:
115                    self.HTuples.append(pauliString)
116                    self.HCoefs.append(coefficient)
117        else:
118            hamiltonianTerms = self.generateHamiltonian(pair[1]) #pair[1] = modelname,
119            if isinstance(pair[0], list): #pair[0] = coefficients float or list
120                if len(pair[0]) != len(hamiltonianTerms):
121                     raise ValueError("Coefficient List mismatch: Expected {} coefficients".format(len(hamiltonianTerms)))
122                pairedIterable = zip(pair[0],hamiltonianTerms)
123                for (coefficient, pauliString) in pairedIterable:
124                    self.HTuples.append(pauliString)
125                    self.HCoefs.append(coefficient)
126            elif pair[0]:
127                coefficient = pair[0]
128                for pauliString in hamiltonianTerms:
129                    self.HTuples.append(pauliString)
130                    self.HCoefs.append(coefficient)
131
132    def addTerms(self, pairs):
133        """Adds custom elements to build out the Hamiltonian
134
135        Args:
136            pair (List of Tuples or Tuple of Lists or Tuple): Formatted as either
137                * `[(coefficient, PauliString), (coefficient, PauliStringTuple),...]`
138                * `(coefficient, (PauliString))`
139                * `([coefficienList],[(PauliStringList)])
140
141        Examples:
142            * `Hamiltonian.addTerms((0.45, (1,3,2,0,0,0)))`
143            * `Hamiltonian.addTerms([(1,(1,1,0,0)),(2,(2,2,0,0))])
144            * `Hamiltonian.addTerms(([co1, co2, co3, ...],[(PauliString1),(PauliString2),(PauliString3)...])`
145
146        """
147        if isinstance(pairs, list): #Verifies the User input - if a list, iterates over it
148            for pair in pairs:
149                try: #Checks if the element is already in the list and adds it
150                    index = self.HTuples.index(pair[1])
151                    self.HCoefs[index] = self.HCoefs[index] + pair[0]
152                except: #If not in the list, catches warning and adds the new term
153                    self.HTuples.append(pair[1])
154                    self.HCoefs.append(pair[0])
155        elif isinstance(pairs, tuple): #Verifies user input - if a tuple, just adds it
156            if isinstance(pairs[0], list):
157                for (co, tup) in zip (pairs[0], pairs[1]):
158                    try: #Checks if the element is already in the list and adds it
159                        index = self.HTuples.index(tup)
160                        self.HCoefs[index] = self.HCoefs[index] + co
161                    except: #If not in the list, catches warning and adds the new term
162                        self.HTuples.append(tup)
163                        self.HCoefs.append(co)
164            else:
165                try: #Checks if the element is already in the list and adds it
166                    index = self.HTuples.index(pairs[1])
167                    self.HCoefs[index] = self.HCoefs[index] + pairs[0]
168                except: #If not in the list, catches warning and adds the new term
169                    self.HTuples.append(pairs[1])
170                    self.HCoefs.append(pairs[0])
171
172    def removeTerm(self, tup):
173        """Removes the term matching the tuple input. Used for trimming terms off the Hamiltonian
174        Args:
175            tup (tuple): A (pauliString)
176        """
177        index = self.HTuples.index(tup)
178        
179        self.HTuples.pop(index)
180        self.HCoefs.pop(index)
181
182    def generateHamiltonian(self, modelType, closed = False):
183        """Helper Function to generate Hamiltonians.
184        
185        From the model type, generates the Hamiltonian Pauli Strings
186
187        Args: 
188            modelType (Tuple of Strings): See previous documentation
189            closed (bool): 
190                True if the model is period.
191
192        """
193        hamiltonian = []
194
195        if modelType == "xx": #XXII + IXXI + IIXX
196            for i in range(self.sites - 1):
197                term = ((0,) * i) + ((1,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
198                hamiltonian.append(term)
199            if  closed:
200                term = (1,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (1,)
201                hamiltonian.append(term)
202
203            
204            
205        elif modelType == "yy": #YYII + IYYI + IIYY
206            for i in range(self.sites - 1):
207                term = ((0,) * i) + ((2,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
208                hamiltonian.append(term)
209            if  closed:
210                term = (2,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (2,)
211                hamiltonian.append(term)
212
213            
214            
215        elif modelType == "zz": #ZZII + IZZI + IIZZ
216            for i in range(self.sites - 1):
217                term = ((0,) * i) + ((3,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
218                hamiltonian.append(term)
219            if  closed:
220                term = (3,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (3,)
221                hamiltonian.append(term)
222
223
224        elif modelType == "xy": #XXII + YYII + IXXI + IYYI + IIXX + IIYY
225            for i in range(self.sites - 1):
226                termX = ((0,) * i) + ((1,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
227                termY = ((0,) * i) + ((2,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
228                hamiltonian.append(termX)
229                hamiltonian.append(termY)
230            if  closed:
231                termX = (1,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (1,)
232                termY = (2,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (2,)
233                hamiltonian.append(termX)
234                hamiltonian.append(termY)
235
236            
237        elif modelType == "kitaev_even": #XXII + IYYI + IIXX
238            for i in range(self.sites - 1):
239                if i % 2 == 0:
240                    term = ((0,) * i) + ((1,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
241                else:
242                    term = ((0,) * i) + ((2,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
243                hamiltonian.append(term)
244            if  closed:
245                term = (2,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (2,)
246                hamiltonian.append(term)
247
248            
249            
250        elif modelType == "kitaev_odd": #YYII + IXXI + IIYY
251            for i in range(self.sites - 1):
252                if i % 2 == 0:
253                    term = ((0,) * i) + ((2,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
254                else:
255                    term = ((0,) * i) + ((1,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
256                hamiltonian.append(term)
257            if  closed:
258                term = (1,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (1,)
259                hamiltonian.append(term)
260
261
262
263        elif modelType == "heisenberg": #XXII + YYII + ZZII + ...
264            for i in range(self.sites - 1):
265                termX = ((0,) * i) + ((1,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
266                termY = ((0,) * i) + ((2,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
267                termZ = ((0,) * i) + ((3,) * 2) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
268                hamiltonian.append(termX)
269                hamiltonian.append(termY)
270                hamiltonian.append(termZ)
271            if  closed:
272                termX = (1,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (1,)
273                termY = (2,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (2,)
274                termY = (3,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (3,)
275                hamiltonian.append(termX)
276                hamiltonian.append(termY)
277                hamiltonian.append(termZ)
278
279            
280
281        elif modelType == "tfim": # ZZII + IZZI + IIXZZ + XIII + IXII + IIXI + IIIX
282            #raise Exception("Warning: TransverseIsing Involution not yet implemented, so m construction will fail")
283            for i in range(self.sites - 1):
284                term = ((0,) * i) + (3,3) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2 - i))
285                hamiltonian.append(term)
286            if  closed:
287                term = (3,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 2)) + (3,)
288                hamiltonian.append(term)
289            for i in range(self.sites):
290                term = ((0,) * i) + (1,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 1 - i))
291                hamiltonian.append(term)
292
293        elif modelType == 'tfxy':
294            for i in range(self.sites):
295                term = (0,)*i + (3,) + (0,)*(self.sites-i-1) 
296                hamiltonian.append(term)
297            
298            for i in range(self.sites-1):
299                term = (0,)*i + (1,1) + (0,)*(self.sites-i-2) 
300                hamiltonian.append(term)
301                term = (0,)*i + (2,2) + (0,)*(self.sites-i-2) 
302                hamiltonian.append(term)
303                
304            if closed:
305                term = (1,) + (0,)*(self.sites-2) + (1,)
306                hamiltonian.append(term)
307                term = (2,) + (0,)*(self.sites-2) + (2,)
308                hamiltonian.append(term)
309            
310
311        elif modelType == "transverse_z": # ZIII + IZII + IIZI + IIIZ
312            for i in range(self.sites):
313                term = ((0,) * i) + (3,) + ((0,) * (self.sites - 1 - i))
314                hamiltonian.append(term)
315
316        else:
317            raise Exception("Invalid Model. Valid models include: 'XX', 'YY', 'ZZ', 'XY', 'KitaevEven', 'KitaevOdd', 'Heisenberg', TransverseIsing', and 'Transverse_Z'")
318        return hamiltonian
319        
320    def getHamiltonian(self, type='tuples'):
321        """ Based on the type, returns the Hamiltonian from the object and formats it.
322        Args:
323            type (String, default = 'tuples'): Specifies the return type of the function.
324                Valid inputs:
325
326                 - 'tuples': Return formatted as `[(coefficient, (PauliString), ... ]`
327
328                 - 'printTuples': Prints out to the console ``(coefficient, (PauliString)) \n ...``
329
330                 - 'printText': Prints out ``'coefficient * 'PauliString' + ....``
331
332                 - 'text': Return formatted as a list of `[[coefficient, 'PauliString']]`
333        
334        Returns:
335            For type=`'tuples'` or type=`'text'`, returns
336
337            - `'tuples'`: A list of Coefficient, (PauliString) Tuple pairs
338            - `'text'`: A List of Coefficient 'PauliString' List pairs
339        
340        Raises:
341            ValueError: Invalid type
342        """
343        if type == 'tuples':
344            returnVal = []
345            for (co, tup) in zip(self.HCoefs, self.HTuples):
346                returnVal.append((co,tup))
347            return returnVal
348        elif type == 'printTuples':
349            for (co, tup) in zip(self.HCoefs, self.HTuples):
350                print((co,tup))
351        elif type == 'printText':
352            for (co, tup) in zip(self.HCoefs, self.HTuples):
353                print(str(co) + " * " + str(paulilabel(tup))) #Prints coefficient'pauliString'
354        elif type == 'text':
355            returnlist = []
356            for (co, tup) in zip(self.HCoefs, self.HTuples):
357                returnlist.append([co,  str(paulilabel(tup))]) #Prints coefficient'pauliString'
358            return returnlist
359        else:
360            raise ValueError('Invalid Type: Must be "tuples", "printTuples", "printText", or "text"')

def addModel(self, pair): 
 80    def addModel(self, pair):
 81        """Adds a predefined model to the Hamiltonian object
 82        
 83        Args:
 84            pair (Tuple):
 85                
 86                ### Currently Implemented Models:
 87                    - xy: (XX + YY)
 88                    - xx: (XXI + IXX)
 89                    - yy: (YYI + IYY)
 90                    - zz: (ZZI + IZZ)
 91                    - tfim: (ZZ + XI + IX)
 92                    - tfxy: (XX + YY + ZI + IZ)
 93                    - transverse_z: (IZ + ZI)
 94                    - kitaev_even: (XXI + IYY)
 95                    - kitaev_odd: (YYI + IXX)
 96                    - heisenberg: (XX + YY + ZZ)
 97                    - TODO: hubbard: (XXII + YYII + IIXX + IIYY + ZIZI + IZIZ)
 98        
 99        Raises:
100            ValueError:  Coefficient list length mismatch
101            Exception: Invalid model type input
102        """
103        if len(pair) == 3: #Handles the boundary condition variable format
104            hamiltonianTerms = self.generateHamiltonian(pair[1], closed=pair[2]) #pair[1] = modelname, pair[2] = boundary condition
105            if isinstance(pair[0], list): #pair[0] = coefficients float or list
106                if len(pair[0]) != len(hamiltonianTerms):
107                     raise ValueError("Coefficient List mismatch: Expected {} coefficients".format(len(hamiltonianTerms)))
108                pairedIterable = zip(pair[0],hamiltonianTerms)
109                for (coefficient, pauliString) in pairedIterable:
110                    self.HTuples.append(pauliString)
111                    self.HCoefs.append(coefficient)
112            elif pair[0]:
113                coefficient = pair[0]
114                for pauliString in hamiltonianTerms:
115                    self.HTuples.append(pauliString)
116                    self.HCoefs.append(coefficient)
117        else:
118            hamiltonianTerms = self.generateHamiltonian(pair[1]) #pair[1] = modelname,
119            if isinstance(pair[0], list): #pair[0] = coefficients float or list
120                if len(pair[0]) != len(hamiltonianTerms):
121                     raise ValueError("Coefficient List mismatch: Expected {} coefficients".format(len(hamiltonianTerms)))
122                pairedIterable = zip(pair[0],hamiltonianTerms)
123                for (coefficient, pauliString) in pairedIterable:
124                    self.HTuples.append(pauliString)
125                    self.HCoefs.append(coefficient)
126            elif pair[0]:
127                coefficient = pair[0]
128                for pauliString in hamiltonianTerms:
129                    self.HTuples.append(pauliString)
130                    self.HCoefs.append(coefficient)

def addTerms(self, pairs): 
132    def addTerms(self, pairs):
133        """Adds custom elements to build out the Hamiltonian
134
135        Args:
136            pair (List of Tuples or Tuple of Lists or Tuple): Formatted as either
137                * `[(coefficient, PauliString), (coefficient, PauliStringTuple),...]`
138                * `(coefficient, (PauliString))`
139                * `([coefficienList],[(PauliStringList)])
140
141        Examples:
142            * `Hamiltonian.addTerms((0.45, (1,3,2,0,0,0)))`
143            * `Hamiltonian.addTerms([(1,(1,1,0,0)),(2,(2,2,0,0))])
144            * `Hamiltonian.addTerms(([co1, co2, co3, ...],[(PauliString1),(PauliString2),(PauliString3)...])`
145
146        """
147        if isinstance(pairs, list): #Verifies the User input - if a list, iterates over it
148            for pair in pairs:
149                try: #Checks if the element is already in the list and adds it
150                    index = self.HTuples.index(pair[1])
151                    self.HCoefs[index] = self.HCoefs[index] + pair[0]
152                except: #If not in the list, catches warning and adds the new term
153                    self.HTuples.append(pair[1])
154                    self.HCoefs.append(pair[0])
155        elif isinstance(pairs, tuple): #Verifies user input - if a tuple, just adds it
156            if isinstance(pairs[0], list):
157                for (co, tup) in zip (pairs[0], pairs[1]):
158                    try: #Checks if the element is already in the list and adds it
159                        index = self.HTuples.index(tup)
160                        self.HCoefs[index] = self.HCoefs[index] + co
161                    except: #If not in the list, catches warning and adds the new term
162                        self.HTuples.append(tup)
163                        self.HCoefs.append(co)
164            else:
165                try: #Checks if the element is already in the list and adds it
166                    index = self.HTuples.index(pairs[1])
167                    self.HCoefs[index] = self.HCoefs[index] + pairs[0]
168                except: #If not in the list, catches warning and adds the new term
169                    self.HTuples.append(pairs[1])
170                    self.HCoefs.append(pairs[0])
